description: landscape with mountains and water: tree lined mountain range near top; shore and peninsula lined with small huts; tall cliffs on either side frame the water; at bottom, a tall pine tree creates depth; at LL, a small figure in white robe with walking stick looks out onto scene
inscription: 緑石求魚　水清淺隔　雲聴鳥樹　扶疎出門　行楽復還　室斜日在　窓重読書 (Along the rocks I search for fish / where water\'s clear and shallow; / Beyond the clouds I hear the birds / where trees spread in profusion. / I go out my gate to enjoy myself, / then return back home; / As setting sunlight shines through the window / again I read my books.) [Jonathan Chaves]
markings: poem UR red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #3]; poem LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4]; LLC red seal: 蓬莱山下人 {Hōraisan genin}
signed:
時在昭和戊辰仲夏於東山草堂古道人詩畫 {jizai Shōwa tsuchinoe-tatsu chūka oite Higashiyama sōdō Kodōjin shiga} (the time is May 1928, at a thatched hut in Higashiyama, poem and painting by Kodōjin)


時在昭和戊辰仲夏於東山草堂古道人詩畫 (The time being May 1928, at Thatched Hut at the East Mountain, poetry and painting by Kodōjin)
text:
Rendered in varying shades of black and gray, this work shows Fukuda Kodōjin’s extreme use of spatial contrasts. By employing different angles for foreground, center, and background, he creates a complex composition with multiple vantage points.

Along the rocks I search for fish 
where water’s clear and shallow;
Beyond the clouds I hear the birds
where trees spread in profusion.
I go out my gate to enjoy myself,
then return back home;
As setting sunlight shines through the window
again I read my books.
(Trans. by Jonathan Chaves)
title: Silhouettes of Sails and Glowing Pine Trees
